title: Donald Trump tells Mexican president to pay for the wall or cancel his visit as Theresa May due to land in US
text:
News Live Donald Trump tells Mexican president to pay for the wall or cancel his visit as Theresa May due to land in US 26 January 2017 • 3:05pm View of the border fence between Mexico and US taken from Mexico's side on January 25, 2017, in Tijuana Credit: AP Trump to give speech at Republican gathering in Philadelphia today Theresa May to become first foreign leader ever to address the meeting May to hold talks with Trump tomorrow Trump's plan for immigration 
D onald Trump on Thursday morning told the president of Mexico, via Twitter, that he must agree to pay for the border wall, or else cancel his visit planned for next week. 
The previous day Mr Trump signed an executive order to begin construction of the wall. 
Enrique Pena Nieto, the Mexican president, then took to Facebook to publish a video directly addressing the Mexican people and telling them their country would refuse to pay. 
His remarks angered the president, on his fourth day in office. of jobs and companies lost. If Mexico is unwilling to pay for the badly needed wall, then it would be better to cancel the upcoming meeting. — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 26, 2017 
And the escalating row came as both Mr Trump and Theresa May prepare to address a Republican gathering in Philadelphia. 
M rs May is expected to use her remarks to say that Britain and the US, both undergoing fundamental change, can work together and be strongly united. 
Critics of Mr Trump in the UK are urging Mrs May to express her concerns about his divisive rhetoric. Auto update Republican leaders weigh in 
I n Philadelphia, Republican leaders are assembling for their "Congress of tomorrow Republican member retreat". 
Mitch McConnell, senate leader, was asked whether Mr Trump should tone down his rhetoric against Mexico. 
I don't have any advice to give to the president about that issue. 
We are moving ahead with the $12-15 billion. 
We attend to address the wall issue ourselves, and we intend to let the president deal with the relationship with Mexico. 
Paul Ryan, speaker of the house, asked about the relationship with Mexico simply said: 
I think it will be fine. Paul Ryan Trump v Pena Nieto row heats up 
E nrique Pena Nieto, the Mexican president, is in an unenviable position. 
He is due to meet President Donald Trump at the White House on Tuesday afternoon. Enrique Pena Nieto, the Mexican president 
B ut yesterday, Mr Trump signed an executive order to begin the construction of the wall. Mr Pena Nieto has long said that he disagrees with the wall, saying Mexico believes in building bridges rather than walls. 
Mr Trump insists Mexico will pay. Mr Pena Nieto insists Mexico will not. 
The Mexican president published a Facebook video yesterday evening restating that Mexico will not pay.
